document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Megabeleses Takeuchi (Hymenoptera, Tenthredinidae) with description of two new species from China

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 12–22.
Megabeleses liriodendrovorax Xiao, 1993
. 12. Adult, female; 13. Adult, male; 14. Right mandible; 15. Left mandible; 16. Punctuation of abdominal tergites; 17. Harpe; 18. Apical sheath, dorsal view; 19. Ovipositor sheath, lateral view; 20. Hind tarsus; 21. Penis valve; 22. Lance (arrow indicating membranous lobe of lance).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Host plants.
Liriodendron chinense (Hemsl.) Sarg. (
Xiao, 1993
)
.

Biology. This species is an important pest of
Liriodendron chinense
and only feeds on this plant species.
Ouyang & Huang ( 1993 )
,
Chen ( 1995 )
and
Lin et al . ( 2009 )
reported and described some of its biological characteristics of the species. One generation per year occurs. Prepupae and ooverwinter in the soil..The adults emerge during the last ten days of April up to the middle of June. Eggs are laid separately in mesophyll in the upper side of a leaf. The larvae occur from mid May to mid July.
